channel.title: Own DNS server
channel.description:
Okay, I simply want my own DNS server that links to my files, like you can add a domain to a host like freehostia, awardspace etc etc and the domain is bought somewhere else.
So does anyone has an idea on what software i need? I prefer windows but have also a gentoo server running :)
SOme keywords i could google would be nice.
Thanks in advance, ~S!ms

item.title: Own DNS server
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

I really don’t understand what you mean, because a DNS server never ever links to files.

If it is a DNS server you want, google “Bind DNS”.

It sounds like you want a web server though, I recommend Apache.

Read full topic

item.title: Own DNS server
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You should be able to install the needed software for gentoo via portage.

You can search for packages here: http://gentoo-portage.com

But your best bet on getting help with it is to join irc.moparisthebest.com (freenode) and #gentoo I guarantee if you are patient someone in there will be able to tell you what to do.

Read full topic
